knowledge_transfers: Site audit pattern: Use browser snapshot + DOM analysis for structure review, then add concrete SITE_AUDIT tasks with unique IDs
Positioning unification: When site has multiple offerings, simplify nav to core funnel (Home/Services/Case Studies/About/Contact) and adopt one unifier line site-wide
Dev Tools de-emphasis: Remove from primary nav, implement redirect strategy (301 to /services or /case-studies, or move to /labs off-nav)
Task categorization: Use [SITE_AUDIT], [SITE_IA], [SITE_COPY], [SITE_ROUTES] prefixes for site-related tasks in MASTER_TASK_LOG.md
lessons_learned: Browser snapshot analysis reveals font/rendering bugs (missing letters) that need CSS/font fixes
Site positioning should have one clear unifier line repeated site-wide for consistency
Dev Tools pages can scatter focus; removing from primary nav improves funnel clarity
WordPress default content (Hello world, Uncategorized) hurts SEO and professionalism - easy fix, high impact
next_actions: Assign 8 dadudekc.com tasks to SWARM/Agent-2/Agent-7 for implementation
Create before/after screenshots for site changes once implemented
Monitor StatusChangeMonitor for first auto-resume prompts
blockers: None - all tasks are documented and ready for delegation
tool_wishlist: Site audit automation tool: crawl site, detect 404s, check CTAs, validate forms, generate SITE_AUDIT tasks automatically
